Item ID1042

Blue partyhats are tradable cosmetic items obtained by completing one of the Christmas holiday events that occur once per year. Previously, they were obtainable from 4 July 2013 to 14 July 2013 as part of a rare item drop.

It can be sewn with sagacious spectacles to make Partyhat and specs by talking to Patchy, along with 500 coins. Doing so requires the completion of Cabin Fever and a book o' piracy.

Christmas crackerN/A 115/128

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • A blue partyhat is worn by Wise Old Man who can be found in Draynor Village.
  • Partyhats are infamous in RuneScape history, dating back to RuneScape Classic when they were first introduced to the game during the 2001 Christmas Event. Due to the fact this was the only time a supply of them was added to the game, they quickly became rare items worth hundreds of thousands to millions of gold in the years to come. While partyhats varied wildly in perceived value, raising or dropping by millions of gold in just a few day's time, blue partyhats were typically one of the more expensive ones in RuneScape 2. An estimated figure in 2005 was 60-70 million.

'''Blue partyhats''' are tradable cosmetic items obtained by completing one of the [[Christmas event|Christmas]] [[holiday events]] that occur once per year. Previously, they were obtainable from [[4 July]] [[2013]] to [[14 July]] [[2013]] as part of a rare item drop.

It can be sewn with [[sagacious spectacles]] to make [[Partyhat and specs]] by talking to [[Patchy]], along with 500 [[coins]]. Doing so requires the completion of [[Cabin Fever]] and a [[book o' piracy]].

== Trivia ==

* A blue partyhat is worn by [[Wise Old Man]] who can be found in [[Draynor Village]].
*Partyhats are infamous in RuneScape history, dating back to RuneScape Classic when they were first introduced to the game during the 2001 Christmas Event. Due to the fact this was the ''only'' time a supply of them was added to the game, they quickly became rare items worth hundreds of thousands to millions of gold in the years to come. While partyhats varied wildly in perceived value, raising or dropping by millions of gold in just a few day's time, blue partyhats were typically one of the more expensive ones in RuneScape 2. An estimated figure in 2005 was 60-70 million.
